name: Grand Resort Lagonissi

reviews.text: Great location, roughly 25 minutes from the airport, if you want to avoid a big city like Athens. The entire resort is self contained with several restaurants. While the map on the website makes the resort look huge, its actually not. A quick jog and you can do a full lap in about 5 minutes. The staff is super friendly and helpful. The food was good, but the Asian onsite restaurant has sushi which wasn't particularly special considering you are on the sea. The bungalows are right on the water and offer plenty of space, but other rooms are available for less price further in on land. My room 196 was quiet, but one level above the beach. The room has its own steam room, which is quite unique. The sunset is beautiful. I was here for a business conference, which may interrupt some vacationers.
reviews.title: Paradise for Business Meetings

description: Grand Resort Lagonissi welcomes you to enjoy a seafront paradise, set on a 72-acre verdant peninsula. Boasting twenty exclusive sandy beach coves and lush natural beauty the resort is nestled in a magnificent private peninsula offering breathtaking sunsets and views to inspire.The resort provides endless choices of luxurious accommodations, all on the waterfront with direct access to sandy beaches or to the sea. Deluxe rooms with stunning sea views, bungalows with private pools, suites with gym quarters and villas with private spa areas, compose the Grand Resort’s luxurious scenery. The latest in comfort of technology pervade every single room combined with sleek interiors creating an ambiance of residential charm and unparalleled beauty.
